channel.title: Eaten By A Grue: Infocom, Text Adventures, and Interactive Fiction
channel.itunes:subtitle: Co-hosted by Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston
channel.itunes:author: Monster Feet
channel.itunes:summary: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston discuss and review classic Infocom games, text adventures, and interactive fiction.
channel.description: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston discuss and review classic Infocom games, text adventures, and interactive fiction.

item.title: Sorcerer
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's Second Spellslinger
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Venture forth with the middle child of Infocom's Enchanter series, where food is unnecessary, sleep is unwelcome, and a glass maze can drive you batty.
item.description: Venture forth with the middle child of Infocom's Enchanter series, where food is unnecessary, sleep is unwelcome, and a glass maze can drive you batty.
item.content:encoded:
Venture forth with the middle child of Infocom's Enchanter series, where food is unnecessary, sleep is unwelcome, and a glass maze can drive you batty.

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

Next episode: Plundered Hearts

item.title: Suspended
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's Universal Robots
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Removed from society, frozen in time, and fumbling to interact with the outside world only through remote electronics, Suspended might as well have been called Podcasters.
item.description: Removed from society, frozen in time, and fumbling to interact with the outside world only through remote electronics, Suspended might as well have been called Podcasters.
item.content:encoded:
Removed from society, frozen in time, and fumbling to interact with the outside world only through remote electronics, Suspended might as well have been called Podcasters.

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

Next episode: Sorcerer

item.title: Zork II
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's Supernatural Sequel
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Delve once more into the underground world of Zork where only things you can count on are your low cunning and your high number of saved games.
item.description: Delve once more into the underground world of Zork where only things you can count on are your low cunning and your high number of saved games.
item.content:encoded:
Delve once more into the underground world of Zork where only things you can count on are your low cunning and your high number of saved games.

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

Next episode: Suspended
item.itunes:keywords: Zork II,Infocom,text adventure,interactive fiction,retrocomputer,retro-computer,vintage,adventure games,1980s,1980,80s,Carrington Vanston,Kevin Savetz

item.title: Fooblitzky
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's Board Game
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Fooblitzky is a city of secrets where the crosswalks are deadly, a flasher is dropping pianos on people, and the only job is washing dishes. Oh, and everyone is a dog. This is not an April Fool's episode.
item.description: Fooblitzky is a city of secrets where the crosswalks are deadly, a flasher is dropping pianos on people, and the only job is washing dishes. Oh, and everyone is a dog. This is not an April Fool's episode.
item.content:encoded:
Fooblitzky is a city of secrets where the crosswalks are deadly, a flasher is dropping pianos on people, and the only job is washing dishes. Oh, and everyone is a dog. This is not an April Fool's episode.

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

Next episode: Zork II

item.title: Starcross
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's Space Adventure
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Two podcasters, both alike in indignity, at KansasFest, where unfair puzzles make unfair games unsolvable. In short, this is no Shakespeare and we are not Starcross lovers.
item.description: Two podcasters, both alike in indignity, at KansasFest, where unfair puzzles make unfair games unsolvable. In short, this is no Shakespeare and we are not Starcross lovers.
item.content:encoded:

Next episode: Fooblitzky

item.title: Thimbleweed Park
item.itunes:subtitle: LucasArts' Spiritual Successor
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: The Gruesome Twosome take a vacation from Infocom to visit Thimbleweed Park, where they solve a murder, discuss free will, and admire de lo res graphics.
item.description: The Gruesome Twosome take a vacation from Infocom to visit Thimbleweed Park, where they solve a murder, discuss free will, and admire de lo res graphics.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Sherlock: The Riddle of the Crown Jewels
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's Holmesian mystery
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: It's 19th Century London, and Crown Jewels are missing! Solving the mystery will take all the skills of the world's greatest dectective! You are also there.
item.description: It's 19th Century London, and Crown Jewels are missing! Solving the mystery will take all the skills of the world's greatest dectective! You are also there.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Enchanter
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's magical quest
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Enchanter is filled with magic spells, prophetic dreams, and even a talking turtle. Put on your robe and wizard hat, and prepare for adventure. Accio InvisiClues!
item.description: Enchanter is filled with magic spells, prophetic dreams, and even a talking turtle. Put on your robe and wizard hat, and prepare for adventure. Accio InvisiClues!
item.content:encoded:
Enchanter is filled with magic spells, prophetic dreams, and even a talking turtle. Put on your robe and wizard hat, and prepare for adventure. Accio InvisiClues!

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Next episode: Sherlock, The Riddle of the Crown Jewels

item.title: Deadline
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's first mystery
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Infocom's first mystery: a locked room, six suspects, and a ticking clock. Can a pair of fumbling podcasters solve the murder in time? Probably not.
item.description: Infocom's first mystery: a locked room, six suspects, and a ticking clock. Can a pair of fumbling podcasters solve the murder in time? Probably not.
item.content:encoded:
Infocom's first mystery: a locked room, six suspects, and a ticking clock. Can a pair of fumbling podcasters solve the murder in time? Probably not.

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

Next episode: Enchanter

item.title: Border Zone
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's spy thriller
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Infocom's only espionage story, Border Zone is filled with intrigue and danger in a constantly moving world that doesn't wait while the player types. Tune in to see if our heroes achieve success by stealth, or death by typo.
item.description: Infocom's only espionage story, Border Zone is filled with intrigue and danger in a constantly moving world that doesn't wait while the player types. Tune in to see if our heroes achieve success by stealth, or death by typo.

item.title: Seastalker
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's nautical adventure
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Ahoy! Kevin and Carrington dive into Seastalker, Infocom's junior gee-whiz submarine adventure. Set course for adventure, as we raise our sails and lower our expectations.
item.description: Ahoy! Kevin and Carrington dive into Seastalker, Infocom's junior gee-whiz submarine adventure. Set course for adventure, as we raise our sails and lower our expectations.
item.content:encoded:
Ahoy! Kevin and Carrington dive into Seastalker, Infocom's junior gee-whiz submarine adventure. Set course for adventure, as we raise our sails and lower our expectations.

item.title: Trinity
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's atomic classic
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Trinity is Infocom's classic game about the dangers of the Atomic Age, and it's a blast! Get it? Get it? A blast? Hilarious.
item.description: Trinity is Infocom's classic game about the dangers of the Atomic Age, and it's a blast! Get it? Get it? A blast? Hilarious.
item.content:encoded:

Next episode: Seastalker

item.title: Ballyhoo
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's circus mystery
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to Ballyhoo, Infocom's circus mystery. Can these johnny tin plates foil the grift and save the circus? Or is the cherry pie just too much for a pair of side-walling lot loafers?
item.description: Welcome to Ballyhoo, Infocom's circus mystery. Can these johnny tin plates foil the grift and save the circus? Or is the cherry pie just too much for a pair of side-walling lot loafers?
item.content:encoded:

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

item.title: Zork I: The Underground Empire
item.itunes:subtitle: Infocom's first adventure
item.itunes:author: Monster Feet
item.itunes:summary: Kevin and Carrington discuss Zork I, the first text adventure from Infocom. From the highs of its incredible parser to the lows of its unfair puzzles, it all comes down to one burning question: are you a TAKE person or a GET person?
item.description: Kevin and Carrington discuss Zork I, the first text adventure from Infocom. From the highs of its incredible parser to the lows of its unfair puzzles, it all comes down to one burning question: are you a TAKE person or a GET person?
item.content:encoded:
Kevin and Carrington discuss Zork I, the first text adventure from Infocom. From the highs of its incredible parser to the lows of its unfair puzzles, it all comes down to one burning question: are you a TAKE person or a GET person?

Hosts: Kevin Savetz and Carrington Vanston

Theme tune: "It Is Pitch Dark" by MC Frontalot

Find links, notes, and more episodes of Eaten By A Grue at MonsterFeet.com

Next episode: Ballyhoo
